# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is the solution in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)::String
    words = split(text, ' ')
    result = ""
    line_length = 0
    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        end
        result *= " $word"
        line_length += length(word) + 1
    end
    return result[2:end] # remove the leading whitespace
end

println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed nec diam lacus.", 30))
```
This function will wrap the text into new lines whenever a line length exceeds `text_width`. If you provide special instructions, make sure to incorporate them in this function as per your requirements.

Please replace `"Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed nec diam lacus."` with the text you want to wrap and `30` with your preferred width for wrapping.
